Administering workers’ compensation

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the setup and administration

process of jurisdictional benefit parameters
Describe the setup and administration
process of managing ICD codes

Set up denial periods for jurisdictions

Set up and administer PPD parameters

Set up search columns and default loss types
for users

| Lesson outline

Workers’ compensation setup basics
Jurisdictional benefit parameters

PPD administration parameters
Compensability parameters

ICD-10 codes

User settings

Workers’ compensation setup
basics

| ClaimCenter setup for WC background Gi

¢ To implement the WC Line of Business (LOB), key administration tasks are
required. Most of them are related to:

Benefit calculations for Time Loss Exposures
Compensability Decision Activity

PPD (Permanent Partial Disability) calculations
ICD-10 codes

¢ Note: ClaimCenter sample data provides administration parameters as examples
only

Many parameters are out of date

Some parameters may not be included for some jurisdictions

Consult with official state board guidelines for official WC rates

It is assumed that, during an implementation, many WC parameters will be created, updated, or added

| ClaimCenter WC Administration screens

TF Clsimcenter* Desitop |» iaim|~ Search» AdsressBook | Dashboard Team Administration |

©

and settings

f PPD limits

—— Compensability decision
formulas

| Benefit parameters G&G

¢ Used to calculate payments for lost time
* Contain jurisdiction, start date, and end date

* Sets benefit rates for a specific time period

+ Claims that have a Time Loss exposure matching a jurisdiction and start/end date for the parameter
use the rates on that parameter

* Conditions such as applying minimums and maximums may be used

Sample data provides sample parameters for 15 U.S. states

Note: All sample data is for illustrative purposes only and does not reflect actual rates as
prescribed by law.

=.5B 9b B

Benefit parameters: definitions

All four benefit types (TTD, TPD, PTD, and PPD)
in ClaimCenter come with four “basic”
parameters/rates:

Percent of Wages (decimal): Usually 67%
(two-thirds)

Maximum Weekly Benefit ($): Sets maximum
payout imposed by that jurisdiction.

Minimum Weekly Benefit ($): Sets minimum
payout imposed by that jurisdiction.

Minimum adjusted by Weekly Wage: Yes/No

Gi

| Matching claim data to WC benefit parameters fa

“State of Jurisdiction” on Loss Details matches the Jurisdiction WC parameter

“Loss date’ (or “notice date”) of claim falls between start/end dates in WC
parameter

“Impairment Rating” on Time Loss exposure matches the PPD Weeks WC
parameter (Disability %) (for PPD)

If the following data is provided, the “weekly comp rate” is automatically calculated:

Weekly Wage (Pre-Injury) (AWW)
Weekly Wage Amount (Post-Injury) (for TPD)

Other jurisdictional factors Gi

‘Override Other NJ does not have TPO. Yes

| Impairment rating and disability percentage fa

PPD is calculated using an “impairment rating” in addition to the “standard” 67% of
AWW

This is because PPD is subject to jurisdiction limits including the number of weeks
and maximum benefit amount

The impairment rating quantifies the I|W’s permanent disability and sets the
maximum number of weeks for which an IW is paid

Impairment rating is also known as a “disability percentage”

Because the worker has limited capacity to work, the purpose is to compensate for
that limited capacity (example: “The impairment is 20% because the doctor has
determined that you have lost some ability to move your right arm”)

| PPD administration parameters i

PPD Min / Max Larger maximum
if disability > 70%

Jurisdiction StartDate  — EndDate > Min. PPD Percentage + Max. PPD Percentage > Min.Benefit > Max.Benefit >

california oxjoyj2013 12/81/2013 70 °9 105.00

PPD Weeks
(1-15 0f297) Far) > | » IE=Ba
Jurisdiction 2 StartDate > EndDate + PPD Percentage > Number of Weeks > Separate rows for
California oyo12013 12/31/2014 t each disability %
California 01/01/2013 12/31/2014 2 6 (1-99)
California oyo12o13 12/81/2014 3 9
California 01/01/2013 12/31/2014 4 12

¢ All PPD example parameters are California-only

¢ Purpose is to illustrate how the min/max can be divided by a 1%—-69% / 70%-99%
scale and how each impairment (disability) % equates to the number of weeks the
benefit lasts

| Compensability parameters: denial period

* The denial period is the jurisdiction- 3 calendar days:
specific period of time in which an jurisdiction of Illinois
insurer must respond to a new WC
claim

+ The insurer must respond by accepting or
denying the claim

+ The “Determine Compensability” activity in

ClaimCenter is used to signal this task 21 calendar days:
: . jurisdicti if G i
¢ ClaimCenter provides a way to Jurisaliction of Georgia
customize this denial period for each
jurisdiction:

+ Denial periods may differ by jurisdiction

+ Includes a denial period formula (days after
loss, days after notice, greater of the two)

Administering workers’ compensation

Question G

,- — Which parameter can set the Determine Compensability activity’s due
x date on a claim?
¢
A) Jurisdictional Benefit Parameter
B) PPD Min/Max
C) Waiting Period

D) Denial Period

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer a

,~ — Which parameter can set the Determine Compensability activity’s due

x date on a claim?
74

A) Jurisdictional Benefit Parameter
B) PPD Min/Max
C) Waiting Period
D) Denial Period

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question G

,~ — Whatis the purpose of an impairment rating on a claim? How is this
x matched to admin parameters?

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer a

,~ — Whatis the purpose of an impairment rating on a claim? How is this
¢ matched to admin parameters?

¢
¢

An impairment rating specifies, for PPD, the degree of disability or loss of use the IW
has suffered as part of a permanent disability. It is matched to two admin parameters:
the PPD Min/Max and the PPD # of weeks (for a given jurisdiction and effective
start/end dates)

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question G

_~ — 'fyou want to calculate a TTD weekly comp rate, what data on a claim

x must exist to match admin parameters?

¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

_~ — 'fyou want to calculate a TTD weekly comp rate, what data on a claim

x must exist to match admin parameters?

¢

Three pieces of data:

1. The state (jurisdiction)

2. The claim’s loss date or notice date
3. The worker's AWW.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question G

_~ — 'fyou want to calculate a PPD weekly comp rate, what data on a claim

x must exist to match admin parameters?

¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer a

_~ — 'fyou want to calculate a PPD weekly comp rate, what data on a claim

x must exist to match admin parameters?

¢

Four pieces of data:

1. The state (jurisdiction)

2. The claim’s loss date or notice date
3. The worker's AWW.

4. The impairment rating (disability %)

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD
